summary: This document is a series of internal FBI emails from late June to early July 2020 concerning the planning, approval, and execution of an operation to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails detail logistical planning, cost estimates, and real-time updates on the search for Maxwell's location, which shifted from Massachusetts to New Hampshire.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the target of the FBI's arrest operation in the Epstein investigation. Her phone's historical location data indicated she was in New Hampshire.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The FBI emails confirm that Ghislaine Maxwell was taken into custody. The operation involved executing a search warrant and locating her via phone data.

events.title: FBI Travel and Operation Planning
events.description: The FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit and the New York Field Office coordinated travel approval, cost estimates, and logistical planning for an operation to arrest a target (Maxwell), initially believed to be in Massachusetts.

events.title: Location Shift to New Hampshire
events.description: Based on historical phone data, the target's location was updated from Massachusetts to New Hampshire, requiring a shift in operational planning.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning and executing an operation to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell in late June/early July 2020.
Maxwell's arrest location was determined through historical GPS pings from her phone, which indicated she was in New Hampshire, not the initially suspected Massachusetts.
The operation required logistical coordination, including travel approval, cost estimates for personnel, and the potential movement of technical assets from Boston and Newark.
The arrest of Maxwell triggered a requirement for the FBI to submit a Significant Case Notification (SCN).
The emails show real-time, internal FBI communication regarding a major arrest in the Epstein investigation.
